5.60. 
Renunciation of succession
1. The heir at law or the heir under a will shall have the right to renounce the succession within three months from the date of the occurrence of the succession. It shall not be permissible to renounce the succession with conditions and reservations or partly.
2. The abandonment of the succession shall have the same consequences as the non-acceptance of the succession.
3. The heir shall renounce the succession by filing a declaration with the notary of the place of the occurrence of the succession.
4. The succession may not be renounced if the heir has filed with the notary of the place of the occurrence of the succession a declaration that he accepts the succession or requests the issue of a certificate of the right of succession.
